content.description: A sociologist is studying the social media habits of high school students in a school district. The sociologist wants to estimate the average total number of minutes spent on social media per day in the population. A random sample of 50 high school students was selected, and they were asked, â€œHow many minutes per day, on average, do you spend visiting social media sites?"
content.question: Which of the following is the most appropriate inference procedure for the sociologist to use?

choices.label: A one-sample <math alttext="z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>z</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-interval for a population proportion
A one-sample <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-interval for a population mean
A matched-pairs <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-interval for a mean difference
A two-sample <math alttext="z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>z</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-interval for a difference between proportions
A two-sample <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-interval for a difference between means

content.answer: A one-sample <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-interval for a population mean

topic.text: 7.2: Constructing a Confidence Interval for a Population Mean

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate inference method for confidence intervals.
